name: Mongo
description:
MongoDb is a multi-node distributed database. MongoDB uses sharding to support deployments with very large data sets and high throughput.
This blueprint creates 4 (1 Config Node + 2 Data Nodes or replicasets + 1 Router Node) sharded MongoDb VMs.
#### License:
* Apache License 2.0
* GNU AGPL v3.0
#### Hardware Requirement:
* By default, four VMs each 2 vCPU, 4GB RAM
#### Resources Installed:
* Config set with Mongo 3.4.2
* Date Set with Mongo 3.4.2
* Router VM with Mongo 3.4.2
#### Operating System:
* CentOS Linux release 7.4.1708
* Select the [AWS AMI](https://aws.amazon.com/marketplace/fulfillment?productId=b7ee8a69-ee97-4a49-9e68-afaee216db2e&ref_=dtl_psb_continue) according to the region.
#### Platform:
* AHV
* AWS
#### Lifecycle:
* NA
#### Limitations:
* For evaluation purposes only. Not recommended for production use.
#### Other Instructions:
* Open ports `39017`,`27017` in the AWS security group or firewall
#### Accessibility:
* Using mongodb command line `sudo mongo --host [IP_ADDRESS] --port 27017`
author: Nutanix
